citation.article-title: Two novel psychrotolerant species, Bacillus psychrotolerans sp. nov. and Bacillus psychrodurans sp. nov., which contain ornithine in their cell walls.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus psychrotolerans sp. nov.
Bacillus psychrotolerans (psy.chro.tol'er.ans. Gr. adj. psychros cold; L. pres. part. tolerans tolerating; N.L. part. adj. psychrotolerans colD-tolerating)
Cells are Gram-positive (according to KOH and aminopeptidase tests).
Cell width, 0-4-1 μm; cell length, 2-7 μm.
Spores predominantly round on CASO agar containing Mn2, located terminally (one of the strains tested did not sporulate).
The diamino acid in position 3 of the peptidoglycan side chain is ornithine, and glutamic acid forms an interpeptide bridge.
Does not grow (or only very poorly) in/on nutrient broth or nutrient agar.
Good growth in/on CASO broth or agar.
No anaerobic growth with or without KNO3.
Lower temperature limit for growth: -2°C (type strain) up to 1°C.
Upper temperature limit for growth: 30°C (type strain) up to 40°C.
No growth in the presence of lysozyme.
Growth at 3% NaCl; normally no growth at 5% NaCl (one of the five strains tested positive); no growth at 7% NaCl.
No or only weak acid production from D-glucose, L-arabinose, D-xylose and D-mannitol.
Usually no hydrolysis of pullulan (one of the strains tested positive).
Usually no hydrolysis of gelatin (one of the strains tested positive).
Hydrolysis of Tween 20, 40, 60 and usually also of Tween 80 (two of the strains tested negative).
Isolated from field soil, Göttingen-Weende, Germany.
G+C content of the DNA is 36-38%(Bd) with 36.5% for the type strain.
